NasNetConnect Frontend Documentation

This is the master index for all developer documentation for the apps/connect frontend application.

NasNetConnect is an enterprise-grade MikroTik router management platform with a dual nature:

  1. Router Management — Configuration, monitoring, backup/restore, fleet management
  2. Network Services Marketplace — Downloadable features (Tor, sing-box, Xray-core, MTProxy, Psiphon, AdGuard Home)

It runs as a single Docker container embedded on the MikroTik router itself (<10MB, <50MB RAM).

Where to Start​

RoleStart Here
New to the projectOverview → Environment Setup
Want to run the appKey Commands
Building a featureArchitecture Overview → State Management
Working on UIUI System Overview → Design Tokens
Writing data queriesData Fetching
Writing formsForms & Validation
Adding i18n/a11yi18n Setup
Writing testsTesting Strategy
DeployingDocker Build

Table of Contents​

01 — Getting Started​

  • Overview — What NasNetConnect is, key constraints, target personas
  • Environment Setup — Prerequisites, env vars, dev server
  • Project Structure — Directory tree, import aliases, dependency rules
  • Key Commands — All npm/nx/docker/codegen commands

02 — Architecture​

  • Overview — Monorepo layout, library layers, core design decisions
  • Routing — TanStack Router file-based routing, route tree
  • Provider Stack — Context providers and initialization order
  • Component Architecture — 3-layer system (Primitives → Patterns → Domain)
  • Platform Presenters — Headless + Mobile/Tablet/Desktop presenters

03 — State Management​

  • Overview — State layers, decision tree
  • Apollo Client — GraphQL server state, cache configuration
  • Zustand Stores — UI state, sidebar, notifications
  • XState Machines — Complex flows (VPN, config pipeline, wizard)
  • Apollo Client — REST endpoint coexistence during migration

04 — UI System​

  • Overview — Design system introduction, brand colors, typography
  • Design Tokens — 200+ tokens, semantic vs primitive, Tailwind 4 integration
  • Primitives Library — shadcn/ui + Radix (~40 components)
  • Patterns Library — Composite components catalog (~56 components)
  • Design Tokens — Framer Motion, animation tokens, reduced motion
  • Accessibility — WCAG AAA, 44px touch targets, keyboard nav

05 — Data Fetching​

  • GraphQL & Apollo — Hooks, cache policies, subscriptions
  • Data Fetching — libs/api-client/ organization
  • Code Generation — npm run codegen, generated types and hooks
  • Offline Support — WebSocket subscriptions with graphql-ws

06 — Forms & Validation​

  • Forms Overview — Form setup, field registration, error display
  • Validation Pipeline — Schema design, custom validators, network types
  • Validation Pipeline — Multi-stage validation, async validation
  • Validation Pipeline — Draft → Validate → Preview → Apply → Rollback
  • Wizard Forms — Wizards, inline editing, confirmation dialogs

07 — Cross-Cutting Features​

  • Router Connection — JWT auth, protected routes
  • Alerts System — Alert rules, channels, in-app toasts
  • Change Set System — Cmd+K, global shortcuts
  • Router Connection — Heartbeat, banners, reconnect
  • Drift Detection Feature — Error boundaries, toast errors, fallbacks
  • Design Tokens — Theme provider, CSS variables, token switching
  • Mocking — MSW setup for development and testing

08 — Feature Modules​

  • Dashboard — Home dashboard, DNS lookup, network overview, routes
  • Firewall — Address lists, NAT, mangle, port knocking, rate limiting
  • Network — Interfaces, VLANs, DHCP, bridges, tunnels
  • VPN — VPN clients, VPN servers, WireGuard, OpenVPN, IKEv2
  • Wireless (Wi-Fi) — Wi-Fi interfaces, clients, security config
  • Diagnostics — Traceroute, DNS lookup, port scanner, circuit breaker
  • Logs — Router logs, firewall logs, service logs
  • Services / Plugins — Feature marketplace, install/manage Tor, sing-box, etc.

09 — i18n & Accessibility​

  • i18n — i18next, language detection, lazy loading
  • i18n — DirectionProvider, RTL layout, Tailwind RTL
  • Accessibility — WCAG AAA checklist, axe-core integration

10 — Testing​

  • Testing Overview — Testing trophy, Vitest, RTL, Playwright
  • Unit Testing — Vitest setup, RTL patterns
  • Storybook — Story writing, Storybook 10, a11y addon
  • E2E Testing — Playwright, multi-browser, CHR Docker router simulation

11 — Operations​

  • Development Workflow — Multi-arch image, size constraints, RouterOS deploy
  • Development Workflow — GitHub Actions, quality gates, codegen check
  • Performance — <3MB target, chunk splitting, analysis
